meanings.definition: To carry or haul something heavy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: She was schlepping her suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The movers were schlepping the heavy furniture into the truck.
meanings.sent3: I saw a penguin schlepping a giant fish across the ice.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he was schlepping the weight of the world on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ants schlepping the food back to their nest stuck in my mind.

meanings.sent1: The old dog was schlepping along the path.
meanings.sent2: She was schlepping her feet as she walked tiredly home.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was schlepping its way through the trees at a snail's pace.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be schlepping by as he waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The heavy backpack was schlepping her down the mountain slowly.

meanings.definition: To travel with difficulty or inconvenience.
meanings.sent1: We were schlepping through the crowded airport with all our bags.
meanings.sent2: The family was schlepping their camping gear through the muddy trail.
meanings.sent3: I felt like I was schlepping through a jungle of paperwork at work.
meanings.sent4: The car was schlepping along the bumpy road, making the journey even longer.
meanings.sent5: She was schlepping through the snowstorm to get to the warm cabin.
